course.subject: CHEM
course.name: Analytical Chemistry Laboratory
course.description: This is the laboratory course corresponding to the lecture courses of CHEM 2310 and CHEM 2311. Experiments covered in this course will be closely connected with the topics covered in the lecture courses, including Beer's law, calibration principle, and some basic simple instrumental techniques such as Fourier Transform Infrared Spectrometry, Gas Chromatography, etc. For students in the programs under the four-year degree that designate this course as required course/specified elective.
course.prerequisites: (CHEM 1010 OR CHEM 1020) AND CHEM 1050
course.corequisites: CHEM 2310 OR CHEM 2311

reviews.author: supermin
reviews.title: Similar to CHEM2450 format-wise.
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction

Expt 1 - Calibration of Volumetric Glassware

Expt 2 - HPLC Analysis of Caffeine in Energy and Soft Drinks

Expt 3 - Determination of Chemical Oxygen Demand in Wastewater Sample

Expt 4 -Qunatitative Analysis of Xylene Isomer Using Fourier Transform-IR Spectrometer

Expt 5 - Determination of n-Heptane, n-Octane and n-Decane in unknown sample using GC-FID

Oral Quiz Prep and actual one.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Tung is very kind and will answer questions when asked.
She plays pre-recorded video of lab breifing.

Other professors and TAs also chip in and answer on her behalf at times.

But, the professors' English pronunciations are sometimes difficult to understand. Be weary of that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Refer to workload on how e-reports are done.

Quizzes are easy. Just read through Lab Manual and digest it. All answers are in there.

Oral exam is basically TAs asking ONE question (calculation, concept, definition, etc), and given 3 minutes to answer it on a paper or on ZOOM board thing. Don't have to show working, only the answer is graded. Marked out of 20.

Five e-Reports - 60%
Lab Quiz - 20%
Oral Exam - 20%

I got very good scores for Quizzes.
Slipped badly and got 2/20 for Oral Exam.
Good scores for Report
B at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to plug in all data and values in this specific website given by the professor during introductory session.

MAKE SURE THE DATAS HAVE PROPER SIG FIGS AND ARE ACCURATE. The marking is done by a computer program, so any slight offsets in data input will be marked wrong. TAs or profs will not go through them.

Given that we are all given same pre-processed data, as long as you do the calculations properly, you will get perfect scores.

You're gonna spend at least 3 hours per experiment.

reviews.author: LukaModric
reviews.comment_content:
1. Calibration of Volumetric Glassware
2. HPLC Analysis of Caffeine in Energy and Soft Drinks
3. Determination of Chemical Oxygen Demand in Wastewater Sample
4. Simultaneous Determination of Nitrite and Nitrate Content in Water Sample by Flow Injection Analysis (FIA)
5. Quantitative Analysis of Xylene Isomer (meta-Xylene and para-Xylene) Using Fourier Transform- Infrared Spectrometer (FT-IR)
6. Determiantion of n-Heptane, n-Octane and n-Decane in unknown sample using Gas Chromatograph - Flame Ionization Detector (GCFID)

Online Lab: Expt2/3
reviews.comment_teaching:
The briefing by the instructor is clear.
Some answers to the quiz are not rational.
IAs are nice.
-To be updated-
reviews.comment_grading:
60%  Reports
20%  Lab Quiz
20%  Lab Performance
Take the best 4 out of 6.
-To be updated-
reviews.comment_workload:
Not too much.
No final exam.
Lab reports to be submitted in 24 hours.
Graphs to be submitted in 1 week.
